5.2.17  11:59 am   I want to make a huge positive difference on the world... but I don't know where to start or how to get there. What should I do?

     2 things you can do are: learn more about how the world is, and figure out more clearly how you want it to be. step 3 would be to merge the two but that's not a good starting place that's why it's step 3

5.2.17  11:53 am   why is it that an ensemble with many instruments in the high range can often sound great, but having more than one bass player is often disastrous?

     the harmonic series is really like a tree. the branches get smaller as they go up, so there can be more of them. but 2 trunks would really never work. play 3rds on a piano starting from around middle C, and get lower and lower. you will hear them stop working at a certain point. this will be about 1 octave above the point where 5ths would stop working, and it would be about 2 octaves above the point where single notes stop working, which is usually the end of the instrument (like around low A on piano, or in my opinion B or C) i've found that the harmonic series actually illustrates this exactly. you'll see thirds appear 2 octaves above the source note. so in otherwords if you play thirds in a certain range, the amount of 'mess' it makes is equal to the amount of 'mess' it would make if you played 5ths an octave below that. or a single note 2 octaves below. that's why heavy guitar riffs often use 5ths, and the bass usually plays the same thing 1 octave below, but in a single note. if you try to play 5ths there it just sounds like an earthquake. another interesting way of illustrating this is if you put distortion on and play 5ths, it often sounds exactly like a single note, 1 octave down. it even works if you play 4ths with distortion. it often sounds like a single note 2 octaves below the highest note. again agreeing with the harmonic series that your 2 notes are a part of

5.2.17  11:46 am   Why are things clearer in hindsight?

     because now you have additional knowledge of what used to be the future

5.2.17  11:41 am   hey bill, how's lief? just like you i also realise i won't live forever and therefore i want to spend as much time as possible to reaching my goals, which is make a lot of cool art and learn everything. but i don't know how to do this because i have to work 5 days a week or else i will die a lot sooner and have even less time to work on my goals. any ideas to on tricking the system?

     you just have to work with the amount of time you have. regardless of the amount of time you have, the amount will still be somewhere between zero and infinity, which is exactly the right amount of time for this game to be fun and challenging and also a total nightmare

5.1.17  7:10 pm   what would be your advice on keeping a journal?

     sometimes it's best if you don't call it anything. just freedom

     is it easier to physically write on paper, or is it better to type?

     there are advantages and disadvantages to both. some people type much faster than write. but if it's handwritten you can go readily crazy with the visual style and even draw

     what works best for you?

     at first it was mainly typing, some handwriting. then later on it was a lot of audio/video. then later on it was more just audio

     would typing be safer than writing? (less likely to be lost)

     there are ways for either to get lost

      should i even keep a journal?

     i don't know

      is this too many questions?

     i will check with the rules and regulations

     oh, and how stressed are you?

     just enough

     you should drink more water to stay healthy.

     i already drink a lot of water

     thanks.
